metadata.synopsis: Astarion's default dialog - the dialog you'll get if you speak to him while you're just wandering around in the world. This will cover many different topics, filling out his background and expanding on plot points as they happen in the game. Be aware that at the start of the game, players will not be aware that Astarion is a vampire. These nodes have been marked in the context field.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Recruit Companion Astarion.Speak to companion Astarion.That's it.

22.speaker: Astarion
22.text: You said you had a plan for that hellsbeast - you said we'd kill him!
22.context: InternalNodeContext: IPRD. Flag: Orthon situation resolved without killing the Orthon. Astarion's pissed because Raphael told him to kill the Orthon.

89.speaker: Astarion
89.text: Now the orthon has a new contract, Raphael has his killing machine back, and I have nothing!

30.speaker: Astarion
30.text: Now the orthon's free to traipse back to the Hells and I'm left with nothing.

115.speaker: Astarion
115.text: No information about my scars, no leads on where to turn now, and no idea why I'm wasting my time with you.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: I did what I thought was right.

47.speaker: Astarion
47.text: You thought it was right to take this from me?

92.speaker: Astarion
92.text: My chance to know what Cazador did to me? What he has planned for me?

135.speaker: Astarion
135.text: You had a chance to do the right thing. And you choose a devil over me.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: We can't let one disagreement divide us - we still need each other.

106.speaker: Astarion
106.text: Much as it pains me, you do have a point. Our odds are still better together.

14.speaker: Astarion
14.text: Much as it pains me, you do have a point. Our odds are still better together.

18.speaker: Astarion
18.text: Just know that my patience has its limits, and you're dangerously close to them.

133.text: I needed you for this. And you came up short.

109.speaker: Astarion
109.text: I needed you for this. And you came up short.

35.speaker: Astarion
35.text: I'm done with you - done with everyone. I'll fix this myself; you can rot for all I care.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Trust me, this was for the best. You don't know devils like I do.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Trust me, this was for the best. You don't know devils like I do.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Trust me, this was for the best. You would have been a slave to that devil.

56.speaker: Astarion
56.text: You may be right. That doesn't make it sting any less, though.

65.speaker: Astarion
65.text: You may be right. That doesn't make it sting any less, though.

103.text: It's best for you, maybe - not for me. You've shown your true colours.

93.speaker: Astarion
93.text: It's best for you, maybe - not for me. You've shown your true colours.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: No one's forcing you to be here.

119.speaker: Astarion
119.text: No, I chose this. I trusted you to help me.

6.speaker: Astarion
6.text: Fool that I was. But don't worry, I won't be repeating that mistake.

7.speaker: Astarion
7.text: I wish it were that simple, but our odds of surviving this are still better together.

69.speaker: Astarion
69.text: So, unhappy as it is, our fates still seem to be intertwined.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: Sorry, I should have listened to you.

118.speaker: Astarion
118.text: Of course you should have listened to me!

55.speaker: Astarion
55.text: But you didn't. And now I have to deal with the consequences.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: You're overreacting - we'll find another way to decode your scars.

46.speaker: Astarion
46.text: 'Overreacting'? After what you took from me?

37.speaker: Astarion
37.text: How dare you talk to me after what you've done?
37.context: InternalNodeContext: Flag: Orthon situation resolved without killing the Orthon. Astarion's pissed because Raphael told him to kill the Orthon.

54.speaker: Astarion
54.text: It's curious, I had a visit from our impish friend Raphael last night. He wanted to talk about my scars.

34.speaker: Astarion
34.text: Or rather, he wanted to dangle the promise of talking about my scars in front of me - if we kill that monster of his.

50.speaker: Astarion
50.text: Excellent! I knew you wouldn't baulk at a challenge.

12.speaker: Astarion
12.text: And now all that's left to do is... well, find this damned thing and kill it.

113.speaker: Player
113.text: And I slept right through it all?

76.speaker: Astarion
76.text: You're talking about a vampire and a devil, darling. We're both rather good at sneaking about in the dark.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: You shouldn't have made a deal without talking to me first.

78.speaker: Astarion
78.text: It's not a deal, strictly speaking - more of a gentleman's agreement. 'I scratch your back, you read mine.'

62.speaker: Astarion
62.text: I hope you're not serious about helping that hellsbeast.

79.speaker: Astarion
79.text: We made a deal with Raphael - his destruction for the secrets written on my back.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Don't worry, this is all part of the plan.

120.speaker: Player
120.text: We don't need the devil - we'll figure out what your scars mean some other way.

58.speaker: Astarion
58.text: What if there is no other way? What if this is it?

82.speaker: Astarion
82.text: I'm a pawn in some game, but I need to know what we're playing.

25.speaker: Astarion
25.text: Cazador did something to me - I need to know what it was.

8.speaker: Astarion
8.text: And the only way I'll know for sure is if that orthon dies.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: We'll kill the orthon, don't worry.

20.speaker: Astarion
20.text: All right, if you say so...

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Don't blame me if you made a deal you can't keep.

59.speaker: Astarion
59.text: I see. So that's where we stand.

57.speaker: Astarion
57.text: Very well, then. We'll roll the dice and let's see what fate decides.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: You made a deal with Raphael. I didn't.

74.speaker: Astarion
74.text: This is important. Do not play games with me.

71.speaker: Astarion
71.text: I hope you're not serious about helping that hellsbeast.

80.speaker: Astarion
80.text: You said you had a plan for that hellsbeast - you said we'd kill him!
80.context: InternalNodeContext: Flag: Orthon situation resolved without killing the Orthon. Astarion's pissed because Raphael told him to kill the Orthon.

100.speaker: Astarion
100.text: I've been thinking about the runes Cazador carved into my back.

15.speaker: Astarion
15.text: That fragment of a devil's contract or whatever the hells it is.

53.speaker: Astarion
53.text: I don't know much about Infernal, but I know anything written in devilscript is going to be bad news.

123.speaker: Astarion
123.text: There's something not right about all this. There's more to that 'poem' than everyday sadism.

13.speaker: Astarion
13.text: Maybe something worse than everyday sadism. I saw runes like that on the creatures we fought in the Hells. The message must be Infernal.

11.speaker: Astarion
11.text: I'm afraid that through those runes - somehow - Cazador might still be able to dominate me.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: I can take another look if you want?

44.speaker: Astarion
44.text: Unless you've suddenly become an expert in mysterious runes, I don't think that will achieve much.

48.speaker: Astarion
48.text: No, we need someone with a little more expertise. And I think I know who to ask.

63.speaker: Astarion
63.text: Our devilish friend - Raphael. If anyone's going to know about infernal contracts, he will.

134.speaker: Player
134.text: Are you mad? The devil that's after our souls?

91.speaker: Astarion
91.text: Well, you know what they say - better the devil you know.

28.speaker: Astarion
28.text: I knew you'd see the pragmatic side!

31.speaker: Astarion
31.text: Unfortunately, he comes and goes on his own schedule, so we'll just have to look out for any sulphurous odours or the sound of questionable poetry.

41.speaker: Astarion
41.text: Meanwhile I think I'll spend some time studying the art of infernal negotiations.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: He'll want something in return. Are you sure you can pay his price?

108.speaker: Astarion
108.text: Well, we won't know until we ask, now, will we?

87.speaker: Player
87.text: Just don't rope me into this. Any deals are between you and him.

29.speaker: Astarion
29.text: My friend, I'd never dream of it.

27.speaker: Astarion
27.text: Our devilish friend - Raphael. If anyone's going to know about Infernal text, he will.

84.speaker: Astarion
84.text: Our devilish friend - Raphael. If anyone has the resources to find out what it says, surely he will.

72.speaker: Astarion
72.text: Any excuse to get my shirt off, I see.

17.speaker: Astarion
17.text: But no, I don't think another viewing will serve any purpose. I need someone with a little more expertise.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: All right, what do you want to do about it?

4.speaker: Astarion
4.text: Find an expert, of course. And I already have one in mind.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Did he carve runes into any of the other spawn?

96.speaker: Astarion
96.text: Oh yes, we all got the same treatment.

21.speaker: Astarion
21.text: If there are other parts to this contract, I'm sure they'll be carved into the others.

70.speaker: Astarion
70.text: But I can't exactly stroll up and ask to look at their backs, can I? They're still under Cazador's clawed thumb.

101.speaker: Astarion
101.text: No, I thought I might ask someone else.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: Mizora might have answers. Should I ask her?

51.speaker: Astarion
51.text: Oh no! I wouldn't want to bother your... intimidating companion. I had someone else in mind.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: I may know some... entities that could help?

86.speaker: Astarion
86.text: I was thinking about someone a little more familiar, actually.

127.speaker: Astarion
127.text: How dare you talk to me after what you've done?
127.context: InternalNodeContext: IPRD. Flag: Orthon situation resolved without killing the Orthon. Astarion's pissed because Raphael told him to kill the Orthon.

132.speaker: Astarion
132.text: This dark land must be filled with the broken, the beaten, the desperate.

131.speaker: Astarion
131.text: The perfect preying ground for a devil who offers a way out for those who sign on the dotted line.

125.speaker: Astarion
125.text: I hope we end up seeing our friend Raphael down here somewhere.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Why do you want to see him?

83.speaker: Astarion
83.text: Help me find him, and you'll find out.

67.speaker: Astarion
67.text: You don't have to sign anything, just help me find him.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: That fiend is far from our friend.

111.speaker: Astarion
111.text: I think he'll stay the perfect gentleman. As long as we read the fine print.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: He's a lot of fun and could be useful, if we tread carefully.

60.speaker: Astarion
60.text: When I was taken to his House, I was caught off-guard. But now... Now I know what to ask for.

75.speaker: Astarion
75.text: You will help me find him, won't you?

124.speaker: Player
124.text: Sure, I want to see how this plays out.

116.speaker: Astarion
116.text: Perfect. I knew you would understand.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Not unless you tell me what you're planning.

129.speaker: Astarion
129.text: All in due time. But not now.

121.speaker: Player
121.text: Full of bad ideas though you are, this is definitely one of the worst.

64.speaker: Astarion
64.text: That's quite the achievement. But trust me. I know what I'm doing.

130.speaker: Astarion
130.text: I'm sure he'll turn up at one point or another.
